description: No traction control. No stability control. No ABS. Just 8.0 liters of V10, rear-wheel drive, and your survival instincts. The Viper RT/10 is automotive Darwinism â€” it rewards skill and punishes overconfidence with zero mercy and zero electronic safety nets.
lore: The first-gen Viper didn't even have door handles. Dodge built it as a dare, and every owner accepted. In Nova Pacifica, Viper drivers are either the bravest or the most foolish people on the road. Sometimes both. Always entertaining.
